## Why Do We Need Joins?

```{python}
people
```

```{python}
test_info
```

```{python}
pd.concat([people, test_info], axis=1)
```

```{python}
test_info_disordered 
```

```{python}
pd.concat([people, test_info_disordered], axis=1)
```

```{python}
test_info_multiple
```

```{python}
pd.concat([people, test_info_multiple], axis=1)
```

```{python}
pd.merge(people, test_info)
```

```{python}
pd.merge(people, test_info_disordered)
```

```{python}
pd.merge(people, test_info_multiple)
```

# pd.merge() syntax
 
```{python}
pd.merge(left=people, right=test_info) # left and right arguments 
```

```{python}
pd.merge(people, test_info, on="name") # on argument is optional if the column key is the same in both dataframes
```

```{python}
test_info_different_name
```

```{python}
pd.merge(people, test_info_different_name)
```

```{python}
pd.merge(people, test_info_different_name, left_on='name', right_on='first_name')
```

## Types of joins

## left 

```{python}
people
```

```{python}
test_info_xavier
```

```{python}
pd.merge(people, test_info_xavier, how='left') # left dataframe prioritized right dropped 
```


```{python}
pd.merge(test_info_xavier, people, on='name', how='left') # same thing happens when flipped 
```

## Practice Q: Left Join TB Cases and Continents
The first, tb_cases_children, contains the number of TB cases in under 15s in 2012, by country:

```{python}
tb_cases_children
```

```{python}
country_continents
```


Your goal is to add the continent and region data to the TB cases dataset.

Which dataframe should be the left one? And which should be the right one? Once you’ve decided, join the datasets appropriately using a left join.

```{python}
tb_cases_children_joined = pd.merge(tb_cases_children, country_continents,left_on='country', right_on='country.name.en', how='left')
tb_cases_children_joined
```

## right join

```{python}
pd.merge(people, test_info_xavier, on='name', how='right')
```


## inner join

```{python}
pd.merge(people, test_info_xavier, on='name', how='inner')
```

How many products are there in common between the two datasets. There are 7 products in common. 

Which product has the highest ratio of positive reviews to units sold? (Should be desktops)

## outer join

